name: ДСМ
tagline: Personal page of Dmytro Semenov on github.io
body:
## Projects ### [dsmblog](dsmblog/). ### Static blog made by [pelican](http://blog.getpelican.com/) generator. Base language is Russian. _[code on github](https://github.com/dmisem/dsmblog)_ ### [dsm_pytools](dsm_pytools/). ### Toolkit on python3 that started for studying and practical purposes. _[code on github](https://github.com/dmisem/dsm_pytools)_ ## About me
My name is Dmytro Semenov.
After graduation at the mechanic-mathematical faculty
of Taras Shevchenko University of Kyiv
my professional work is focused on
mathematical and computer modeling, system analysis and design, software development.
I participate in projects of different complexity developing and lecture at the faculty of information systems and technologies of KNEU after Vadim Getman.
### My working tools #### DB, system and application programming * **Delphi** - IDE for projects under Windows. * **Lazarus** - IDE for cross-platform RAD projects with GUI.on * **Python** - Language for system scripting under Linux and cross-platform projects. * **Qt** - cross-platform GUI development under python (*PyQt*) * **Firebird** - free DBMS, the best with Delphi or Lazarus. Used as full-stack db-server or embedded for local projets * **MS SQL-Server** - for training purposes as part of lecturing. * **PostgreSQL**, **MySQL** - DBMS for web-projects. * **SQLite** - platform-independent DBMS for small local (on LAN level) projects. * **MS Access** - DBMS for small local (on LAN level) projects under Windows. #### Modeling * **Matlab** и **GNU Octave** - mathematical modeling and calculations. I prefer GNU Octave as open source project. * **Simulink** - block modeling of system dynamic. * **MS Excel (+VBA)** и **LibreOffice Calc (+StarBasic)** - simple mathematical calculations and modeling. * **Mathcad** - for training purposes as part of lecturing. ####Web * **pelican** - static blog generator based on python, Jinja2, ReStructuredText or Markdown. * I'm focused on studying python-base frameworks (**django**, **pyramid**, **web2py**) for web. [me on github](https://github.com/dmisem)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
